get.summary: Get accounts collection on the ST server.
get.description:
Get collection of accounts on the ST server. Get method returns fully equipped account entities or partial ones based on 'fields' query parameter. One of these links is 'certificates'. 

`Permissions`: "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM". 

Three certificate types are supported for an account entity - login, partner and private. `Login` certificates are used when an account needs to login to ST Server using a certificate or SSH Key. `Partner` certificates are used for encrypting PGP and AS2 data to an account and verifying the signature of data from an account. `Private` certificates are used by ST Server to login to remote Transfer Sites for account as well as for decryption and signing of PGP and AS2 data.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed rows. The limit parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If the limit parameter is set to 0 or it is null then its value will be the value of the global server configuration parameter named 'Webservices.EntriesPerPage' (which by default has value 100).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start row to list. The offset parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.description: The bisuness unit name to filter by.

parameters.description: The route id to filter by.

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: The types of account to filter by. Could be more than one parameter with the same name. Account types are: 'user', 'service' and 'template'.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Account name fragment to filter by, the name that the accounts name or login name contains. That parameter is used in conjunction with fields only.

parameters.name: searchLoginName
parameters.description: When true also search for login names matching this criteria.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The fields of account entity to return. That parameter is used in conjunction with nameContains only. At that version of the API only 'name' field of the account entity is supported.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Account statuses to filter by. Could be more than one parameter with the same name. Account status can be: 'ACTIVE', 'DISABLED', 'LOCKED', 'PENDING' and 'REJECTED'.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request. Example: response code 400 can be observed when set limit or offset parameters to have a negative value or set incorect fields query parameter.

403.description: Unauthorized - insufficient permissions to perform the operation.

404.description: Not Found - for example if businessUnit with specified name or route with specified ID can not be found on the ST server.

post.summary: Create accounts collection on the ST server.
post.description:
Create collection of accounts on the ST server. 

`Permissions`: "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM". 

Depending on the account `type` property there are three types of accounts: user, service and template.

Account entites support custom attributes which can be added via the ST RESTful API. The custom attributes are in the following format: `userVars.{attribute_name}: {attribute_value}`. 

Account entities support repository encryption mode named `encryptMode`. There are two possible options for the encryptMode: 'ENABLED' and 'UNSPECIFIED'. When ENABLED is set then repository encryption for the account is enabled. When UNSPECIFIED is set then repository encryption for the account is not enabled and can be specified with EncryptClass. 

Account entities support a custom property named 'transfersWebServiceAllowed' which is an attribute name to indicate whether access to the transfers resource from the end user RESTful API is allowed.

Account entities support a custom property named 'transferType' which is an attribute name to indicate the transfer type of the account's transfer site. It can be unspecified (`N`), internal (`I`), partner(`E`). By default is unspecified.

Account entities support repository encryption mode named 'routingMode'. There are three possible options for the routingMode: `accept` (the value for Routing Mode that accept transfers), `reject` (the value for Routing Mode that reject transfers) and `ignore` (the value for Routing Mode that ignores transfers). By default is 'reject'.

Account entities support a custom property named 'accountFileArchivingPolicy' that can be set only if the global File Archiving is anabled. There are three possible options for the accountFileArchivingPolicy - `enabled`, `disabled` and `default`. When 'enabled' is set, file archiving will be enabled for this account. When 'disabled' is set, file archiving will be disabled for this account. When 'default' is set, then the following apply: if the account is assigned to business unit, it will inherit its policy, otherwise, the global archiving policy applies.

Account entities support a custom property name 'bandwidthInboundLimit' which defines maximum kb/s applied for inbound transfers per account. The limit will be applied regardless of cluster/streaming deployment configurations or number of sessions open up by each account.

Account entities support a custom property name 'bandwidthOutboundLimit' which defines maximum kb/s applied for outbound transfers per account. The limit will be applied regardless of cluster/streaming deployment configurations or number of sessions open up by each account.

Account entities which are part of the Maker/Checker process flow support the following custom properties named 'verificationStatus', 'submitForApprove' and 'rejectReason'.
- The 'verificationStatus' property indicates whether the account is verified, rejected or pending approval. It has three possible values - 'PENDING', 'APPROVED' and  'REJECTED'. Its value can be changed by Checker or Master administrator.
- The 'submitForApprove' property indicates whether the account is submitted by Maker administrator to be verified by Checker administrator. It can be either 'true' or 'false'. Its value can be changed by Maker or Master administrator. Checker administrators can update the verification status of submitted for approval accounts.
- The 'rejectReason' property can be used to store reasons for rejection and additional notes by Checker and Master administratos.

If an account's type is a template, additional templateClass(String) variable is required - the user class of the template account.

On user account level there are three types of certificates depending on the certificate usage - `login`, `private` and `partner`.

Import X509, SSH or PGP key. Can not import login certificate to account template. The response is holding the newly created Certificate entity.

`Note`: The MIME boundary is hardcoded to 'demoBoundary' because of swagger limitations (reffer to https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/issues/303 for more information).

**Known issue:** The import of x509 certificates of local and private usage can not be done via text representation of the certificate. This can be done with importing the `PKCS #12` format file.

post.summary: Create route step.
post.description:
Create a route step for route template. Additional predefined properties are used for Transformation or Routing steps.

A specific route step should be used to link routes of type TEMPLATE and SIMPLE. This step tells the TEMPLATE route to execute the SIMPLE route. To achieve that, the step properties "type" and "executeRoute" should be set to "ExecuteRoute" and "<some_simple route_id>" respectively.

The other route steps are PgpEncryption, PgpDecryption, Compress, Decompress, LineEnding, ExternalScript, EncodingConversion, CharactersReplace, LinePadding, LineTruncating, LineFolding, Rename, Publish, SendToPartner. The share the common step model properties and have also their own predefined properties.

post.description:
Create collection of Routes on the ST server. It is possible to create three types of Route: TEMPLATE, COMPOSITE, SIMPLE.

The types are used as follows:

Template route type: 
- it can have businessUnits property which is a list of business unit names appropriate for the Administrator who is creating this route
- it may not have account property
- it may not have subscriptions property
- it may not have routeTemplate property

Composite route type: 
- it is to have routeTemplate property pointing to the id of an existing Template Route visible by the account this route is created for 
- it can have account property which is the name of an existing account
- it can have subscriptions property which is a list of subscription id-s which belongs to the account this route is created for
- it may not have businessUnits property

Simple Route:
- it may not have businessUnits property
- it may not have account property
- it may not have subscriptions property
- it may not have routeTemplate property

The route to be created may not have steps property. Steps are managed by the sub-resource steps.

When creating a composite route type to  link a TEMPLATE route to an account, the new composite route properties to set are: name, type - COMPOSITE, routeTemplate - <simple_route_id>, failureEmailNotification, failureEmailTemplate,  failureEmailName, successEmailNotification, successEmailTemplate, successEmailName, conditionType, account - <account or login name to link to>, subscriptions - ["account_subscribtion_id1", "account_subscribtion_id2", ...].

get.summary: Get collection of data transformations.
get.description:
Get data transformation entities for a given transfer configuration.

Data transformation entities support following additional custom properties: 

PARTNER-IN
- `TRANSFORMED_NAME_EXPRESSION_ENABLED` - Specify if the file should be decrypted. It can be 0 or 1.
- `TRANSFORMED_NAME_EXPRESSION` - Specify if the decrypted file is saved to a different name, location or both. You can use a file name expression.
- `REQUIRE_SIGNATURE` - Specify if the file is required to contain a trusted signature or the transfer will fail. It can be 0 or 1.
- `REQUIRE_ENCRYPTION` - Specify if the file is required to be encrypted or the transfer will fail. It can be 0 or 1.
- `ORIGINAL_NAME_EXPRESSION_ENABLED` - Specify if the original encrypted file is saved. It can be 0 or 1.
- `ORIGINAL_NAME_EXPRESSION` - Specify if the original encrypted file is saved to a different name, location, or both. You can use a file name expression.
- `PGP_ENABLED` - Specify if PGP decryption is enabled. It can be 0 or 1.

PARTNER-OUT
  
- `TRANSFORMED_NAME_EXPRESSION_ENABLED` - Specify if the file should be encrypted. It can be 0 or 1.
- `TRANSFORMED_NAME_EXPRESSION` - Specify if the encrypted file is saved to a different name, location or both. You can use a file name expression.
- `compressionLevel` - Specify the compression level. Possible values are 2 (Fast), 5 (Normal), 7 (Good) or 9 (Best).
- `compressionAlgorithm` - Specify what type of compression is used. Possible values are -1 (Preffered), 0 (No compression), 1 (ZIP), 2 (ZLIB) or 3 (BZIP2). Preferred compression methods and order of preference are determined by examining the recipient's PGP key. If the data compression method you choose is not among the recipient's preferred methods, it is possible that the recipient will not be able to access the data.
- `asciiArmor` - Specify if SecureTransport uses ASCII armor encoding. ASCII armor refers to using binary-to-text encoding for plain text data. It can be 0 or 1.
- `ORIGINAL_NAME_EXPRESSION_ENABLED` - Specify if the original unencrypted file is saved. It can be 0 or 1.
- `ORIGINAL_NAME_EXPRESSION` - Specify if the original unencrypted file is saved to a different name, location, or both. You can use a file name expression.
- `PGP_ENABLED` - Specify if PGP encryption is enabled. It can be 0 or 1.

post.summary: Create a single user class on the SecureTransport server.
post.description:
Create a single user class on SecureTransport server.

The required properties in the POST request are: className, userType, userName, group and host.
The order, expression and enabled properties are optional. Default values for this properties are false,"" and 1. During a POST
request the properties enabled and expression can be modified, but all values passed for property order will be ignored and default one will be used.

201.description: A successfully created user class. To access a new resource see the location header.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message describes the reason why the request was incorrect.

put.summary: Update an existing on SecureTransport server user class.
put.description:
Update an existing user class on the SecureTransport server. The update full overwrite the previously existing user class on the SecureTransport server.
 Required information for the user class
fields(className, userType, address and group) must be specified. Optional properties are: enabled, expression and
order. 

The enabled property is used for enabling or disabling the user class instance.
The order property is used to change the position of the user class. When changing position of the user class instance
all user classes before or after the new user class position will be shifted up or down by one position.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message describes the reason why the request was incorrect.

delete.summary: Delete an edge of the DMZ zone entity.
delete.description:
Delete an edge of the DMZ zone entity. 

`Permissions`: "DMZ_ZONE_FORM"

Deleting an edge which is local (such nodes have configurationId specified) should be avoided as it will make your SecureTransport server unusable. This is allowed only in cases where the SecureTransport is configured as a cluster and you're deleting the a local edge of a cluster node that is removed from the cluster. After doing this the removed cluster node can no longer be rejoined to the cluster. You need to start with fresh SecureTransport installation to be able to join the node in the cluster again.

Import X509, SSH or PGP key. Can not import login certificate to account template. The response is holding the newly created Certificate entity. 

`NOTE`: The MIME boundary is hardcoded to 'demoBoundary' because of swagger limitations (reffer to https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/issues/303 for more information).

name.description: The name of the ICAP server

type.description: The type of the ICAP server: INCOMING, OUTGOING or BOTH. INCOMING means that scanning will be performed by this ICAP server for all Incoming transfers: File upload, AdHoc message creation, etc. OUTGOING means that scanning will be performed by this ICAP server for all Outgoing transfers: File download, Reading of an AdHoc message, etc. BOTH means that scanning will be performed by this ICAP server for all types of transfers

enabled.description: Choose whether or not ICAP server to be enabled

url.description: The ICAP server URL in the following format: icap://dlpav-address:port/servicename. The 'servicename' could be the same as the mode of operation - REQMOD or RESPMOD, or it could be something custom and vendor specific. Examples: icap://dlpav-address:1344/AVSCAN, icap://dlpav-address:1344/REQMOD, icap://dlpav-address:11344/RESPMOD

useSecure.description: Indicates if ICAP server should use secure connection

certVerify.description: Indicates if server certificates should be verified or not.

enabledProtocols.description: A list of comma separated SSL protocols to be enabled. The default value is: TLSv1.2

enabledCiphers.description: A list of comma separated ciphers to be used for SSL connection. The default value is: TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_EMPTY_RENEGOTIATION_INFO_SCSV

fipsEnabled.description: Indicates whether or not FIPS transfer mode should be used.

maxSize.description: Messege maximum file size in MB to be sent to the ICAP server. If max message size is set to 0 or negative value, it is considered unlimited

previewSize.description: Preview size in KB. If it is set to 0 or negative value, the whole file is transfered to the ICAP server, otherwise the specified size of the file is sent first. Based on the result of the preview, the scan is either complete or the rest of the file is sent for scan as well.

denyOnConnectionError.description: Indicates whether or not to deny the transfer on connection failure

notifyOnIcapError.description: Indicates whether or not to enable email notifications on connection failure

mailAddressesOnIcapError.description: List of addresses to which email notifications must be sent in case of connection failure

notifyOnIcapDenied.description: Indicates whether or not to enable email notifications on ICAP denied

mailAddressesOnIcapDenied.description: List of addresses to which email notifications must be sent in case of ICAP deny

headersMapping.description: A list of semicolon separated key-value pairs of custom HTTP headers in the following format: 'key=value'. The separator sign '=' is mandatory.

enableWinNtFormat.description: Indicates whether or not to report X-Authenticated-User in WinNT format in case of LDAP authentication.

connectionTimeout.description: Indicates maximum connection tiomeout in seconds

scanWithoutBu.description: Indicates whether or not to enable ICAP scanning for accounts with no Business Unit assigned

ignoredFileTypes.description: List of file extensions separated by comma. Files with these extensions will not be scanned

stopModifyOrNotHandled.description: Indicates whether or not to stop the transfer if ICAP server returns a MODIFY result or an unhandled status

treatModifyAsBlock.description: Indicates whether or not to treat the ICAP MODIFIED action as block

scanPolicyExpression.description: The field allows the usage of ST Expression Language. Based on this expression scanning will be performed or not. Example: ${env['DXAGENT_PROTOCOL'] ne 'ssh'}. Translation: Do not scan if the transfer is taking place over SSH protocol

scanOnlyIfPartnerRecipient.description: Enables or disables ICAP scanning for AdHoc messages if at least one of the recipients is partner. User type - internal or partner - is controlled by the account setting. Possible values are 'Internal' - internal accounts - and 'Partner' - external accounts. If the type of a recipient cannot be identified, the account will be considered External.

name.description: The name of the user (the login name)

authExternal.description: Tells if external authentication is enabled. It has value 'true' if the user authentication is done by an external authentication and 'false' if the user authentication is done by the ST system

lastLogin.description: The time the user last successfully logged in. It has value null if the user never successfully logged in. The time is in RFC 2822 format - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z. Note: This property is read only property. Secure Transport server sets that property on user login.

locked.description: Test if authentication via the user login is disabled. This may be because the user has been locked or the maximum authentication attempts has been exceeded

failedAuthAttempts.description: The number of sequential failed authentication attempts

failedAuthMaximum.description: The number of failed authentication attempts allowed before authentication via the user is disabled. A value of null allows the user an unlimited number of attempts

successfulAuthMaximum.description: The number of successful authentication attempts allowed within a predefined period before authentication is disabled. That period is defined globally. A value of null allows the user an unlimited number of attempts

lastFailedAuth.description: The time of the last unsuccessful authentication attempt. The time is in RFC 2822 format - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z. Note: This property is read only property. Secure Transport server sets that property on failed user login.

passwordCredentials.description: The password attributes for this user.

expiration.description: Specify the site expiration interval in minutes. It can be 1440 (1 day), 10080 (7 days), 43200 (30 days), 86400 (60 days), 'Never'.

to.email.addresses.description: Specify the TO email addresses. Separate email addresses by semicolon (;).

cc.email.addresses.description: Specify the CC email addresses. Separate email addresses by semicolon (;).

bcc.email.addresses.description: Specify the BCC email addresses. Separate email addresses by semicolon (;).

body.description: Specify the message to be sent.

name.description: The name of the login restriction policy. The name can not contain characters "/", ";" and "'"

type.description: The type of the login restriction policy

description.description: The description of the login restriction policy

businessUnits.description: Names of business units that are assigned to the login restriction policy to

isDefault.description: Define whether the policy is the default one for the ST server

homeFolder.description: The home folder on the local system used for this account. The folder path name must be a valid absolute directory name

uid.description: The numeric user ID of the account. Required for SecureTransport installation running on UNIX environment.

gid.description: The numeric group ID of the account

mappedUser.description: The name of the real user mapped to this account for SecureTransport installation running on Windows environment.

disabled.description: This property defines if this account is disabled. If the account is disabled: 1) Subscriptions for the account will not trigger. ; 2) Users associated with the account will not be able to login and perform any transfers

enum: Axway Box and Stripe in Blue

notes.description: An unstructured comments to the account

type.description: The account type. Type 'user' means user account; type 'service' means service account; type 'template' means account template

unlicensed.description: This property defines if the account is an unlicensed account

authByEmail.description: This property defines if authentication by email address is allowed for this account

businessUnit.description: The business unit that account belongs to

loginRestrictionPolicy.description: The login restriction policy for this account

contact.description: The address book contact which is associated tith an account entity. Reffer to the 'AccountContact' definition

deliveryMethod.description: This property defines the delivery method. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Disabled' then Adhoc is disabled and enrollmentType/implicitEnrollmentType can not be set. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Default' then it is only available on BU and Account (setting the BU to use the value and account to use the BU value). When deliveryMethod is set to 'Anonymous' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous' and "" (empty string for Select by sender) are enabled. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Account Without Enrollment' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous', ""  (empty string for Select by sender) and 'Existing Account' are enabled. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Account With Enrollment' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous', "" (empty string for Select by sender), 'Enroll unlicensed', 'Enroll licensed' are enabled

enrollmentTypes.description: This property is used for a custom delivery method and can be set only if deliveryMethod property is set to 'Custom'

implicitEnrollmentType.description: The Implicit Enrollment Type value controls which option Web Access Plus selects initially in the User Access window and which enrollment type is used by the Axway Email Plug-ins. The choices depend on the enrollment types enabled by the Delivery Methods and Enrollment Types fields

isUnlicensedUserAllowedToReply.description: This property defines if the unlicensed user may reply to packages

wapAppletEnabled.description: This property defines if Java WAP applet enabled or not for this account. This property is deprecated.

id.description: The id of the data transformation

type.description: The type of the data transformation.

id.description: The ID of the certificate entity

subject.description: The the certificate subject DN (distinguished name) in RFC2253 format. Example: 'CN=test,OU=Axway_TT,O=Axway,L=Sofia,ST=Sofia,C=Bulgaria'

type.description: The type of the certificate entity as string

usage.description: The usage of the certificate entity as string

expirationTime.description: The certificate expiration time in Unix Timestamp format. This is a read only property and it is automatically calculated depending on the 'validityPeriod' property

creationTime.description: The creation time of the certificate entity in Unix Timestamp format

signAlgorithm.description: The certificate signature algorithm as string

keySize.description: The size of the key. The default CA key size is 2048

keyAlgorithm.description: The name of the algorithm for generated key. Only for certificate entities of type 'pgp' this property can be set (for certificate entities of type 'x509' this property is automatically being set to 'RSA' when generate a 'x509' certificate

issuer.description: The issuer of the certificate. This is a auto generating read only property

serialNumber.description: The serial number. This is a auto generating read only property

fingerprint.description: The certificate fingerprint. This is a auto generating read only property

accessLevel.description: The access level to this certificate for other accounts

overwrite.description: Define whether to overwrite the certificate if a certificate with the same name, type and usage already exists

caPassword.description: The password of the CA for the certificate generation

exportPrivateKey.description: Define whether to export the private key or not

exportSSHPublicKey.description: Define whether to export the SSH public key or not

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property

transferSiteExpressionType.description: Site names or expression for it will be used

uploadFolder.description: You can specify an upload folder that will overwrite the one configured in the transfer site settings (if allowed in the transfer site). Expression language can be used to specify the new upload folder

actionOnStepFailure.description: Action on step failure. If set to PROCEED, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails

transferProfileExpression.description: Transfer profile property is used only if the transfer site is of type PeSIT. Otherwise it will be ignored. When the transfer profile is specified by using Expression Language there are 3 possible cases: (1) EL expression does not match any account transfer profiles - the default transfer profile is used then. (2) EL expression matches more than one transfer profile - the default transfer profile is used. (3) EL expression matches exactly one transfer profile - the matched transfer profile is used.

storeAndForwardMode.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. All the advanced PeSIT settings are included or all are ommitted. "Preserve" Store and Forward mode will preserve the current Store and Forward transfer (if any). "Start new" will initiate a new Store and Forward transfer and the current transfer (if any) will be acknowledged.

virtualFilename.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the virtual file name (PI12) predefined in the transfer profile. To preserve it use ${pesit.pi.fileName}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the idf parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

recordFormat.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. "Variable", "Fixed". Use this field to override the record format (PI31) predefined in the transfer profile. To preserve it use ${pesit.pi.recordFormat}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the frecfm parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

recordLength.description: Use this field to override the record length (PI32) predefined in the transfer profile. To preserve it use ${pesit.pi.recordLength}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the frecl parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

fileLabel.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the file label (PI37) predefined in the transfer profile. To preserve it use ${pesit.pi.fileLabel}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the nfname parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

finalDestination.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the final destination (PI62) of the transfer. To preserve the original value use ${pesit.pi.finalDestinationID}. To make a Store and Forward PeSIT transfer specify the final destination and choose the intermediate partner (ipart parameter in Axway Transfer CFT) in the transfer site list.

userMessage.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. The Last PeSIT specific setting. Use this field to override the user message (PI99) predefined in the PeSIT transfer site. To preserve use ${pesit.pi.serviceParam}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the parm parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

triggerFileName.description: Name of the trigger file to be sent to the transfer site after successful routing of file(s). EL expressions are supported

triggerTargetAccountExpression.description: An account name, login name or use an expression to determine the recipient based on the environment information

triggerFileContent.description: The content of the trigger file. Expression language is supported

postRoutingActionType.description: Post routing action types: NONE, DELETE, RENAME. Default is no action (NONE)

sleepIncrementBetweenRetries.description: Time (in milliseconds) with which the sleep interval between retries will be increased after each retry

sleepBetweenRetries.description: Time interval (in milliseconds) which will be awaited between retries

maxParallelClients.description: Maximum number of transfers that will be executed in parallel by the step

maxNumberOfRetries.description: Number of times each transfer will be retried if it fails. The retries are executed synchronously and the step will not finish execution until all files are sent successfully or the retry count configured in this property is reached

triggerFileForEach.description: Trigger file output for each transferred file

triggerTransferProfileExpression.description: Transfer profile property is used only if the transfer site is of type PeSIT. Otherwise it will be ignored

triggerUploadFolder.description: You can specify an upload folder that will overwrite the one configured in the transfer site settings(if allowed in the transfer site). Expression language can be used to specify the new upload folder

archivePolicyOnFailure.description: Backup the files in the configured archive folder if the step execution fails. By default will archive the files based on the account configuration

archivePolicyOnSuccess.description: Backup the files in the configured archive folder if the step execution succeeds. By default will archive the files based on the account configuration

StandardRouterApplication.title: StandardRouterApplication

OUTBOX_ENABLED.description: [Allow Subscribers to Submit files in this Application] When this property is set to true then permit incoming file transfers from the subscriber parties to the application and following properties can be set: OUTBOX_FOLDER, SECURE_CONNECTION_REQUIRED, RENAME_FILES and OUTGOING_FILENAME_FORMAT

OUTBOX_FOLDER.description: The name of the folder where incoming transferred files are submitted via subscriptions

SECURE_CONNECTION_REQUIRED.description: Define whether to enable SSL for the incoming transfers

RENAME_FILES.description: Define whether to add a prefix to the file name identifying the sender before it is sent to the internal system

OUTGOING_FILENAME_FORMAT.description: The format of the new file name. By default, the file is renamed in the format <ID>\_<FILENAME> where, <ID> is the Subscriber ID specified when the subscription is created, <FILENAME> is the original name of the transferred file and "\_" is the delimiter. The use of the placeholders, <ID>,<FILENAME> and the delimiter in the new file name format is mandatory

INBOX_ENABLED.description: [Send files to Subscribers] When this property is set to true then permit outgoing file transfers from the application to the subscribed parties. The properties INBOX_FOLDER and ID_FROM_FILENAME_EXTRACTION_PATTERN can be set

INBOX_FOLDER.description: [Receive folder] The name of the folder where outgoing transferred files are submitted to the subscriber. The receive folder is created as a sub-folder of the subscription folder

ID_FROM_FILENAME_EXTRACTION_PATTERN.description: A pattern in the ID Pattern box to define the ID of the subscriber to whom files are routed. By default, the pattern is <ID>\_<FILENAME> where, <ID> is a regular expression corresponding to the Subscriber ID specified when the subscription is created, <FILENAME> is the original name of the transferred file and and "\_" is the delimiter. The use of the placeholders, <ID>,<FILENAME> and the delimiter in the new file name format is mandatory.

host.description: Specify the remote site server host.

port.description: Specify the remote site server port.

dmz.description: Specify the remote site network zone. It can be 'any', 'none', 'Default' or custom network zone.

download.folder.advanced.expression.enab.description: When it is 'true' the download folder is evaluated using expression language.

download.pattern.advanced.expression.ena.description: When it is 'true' the download pattern is evaluated using expression language.

download.pattern.type.description: Specify the download pattern type. Pattern matching expression supports 'glob' and 'regex' syntaxes.When the pattern type is "File Globbing" then the String representation of the filename is matched using a limited pattern language that resembles regular expressions but with a simpler syntax.

upload.folder.overridable.description: Defines if the upload folder can be modified by the Send To Partner routing step. It can be '0' or '1'.

transfer.mode.description: Specify the transfer mode. It can be A (Ascii), I (Binary). When it is not define the transfer mode is Auto detected.

verifyFinger.description: Defines whther to verify fingerprint for this site or not. It can be '0' or '1'.

fipsMode.description: Specify if the FIPS Transfer Mode is enabled or disabled. This property can be set if FTPS (issecure) is used. It can be '0' or '1'.

usePassword.description: Specify if the login password should be set. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

usePasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have password expressions or not. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

password.description: Specify the site login password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'usePassword' is 'true'.

socketTimeout.description: Specify the maximum number of seconds the server waits to read a block of data from the partner server, or write a block of data to the partner server. If not specified, its value is '300' - 300 seconds. This option corresponds to the SO_RCVTIMEO and SO_SNDTIMEO Socket options.

socketBufferSize.description: Specify the size of the receive buffer in bytes used from the socket opened during the transfer. It is used by the platform's networking code as a hint for the size to set the underlying network I/O buffers. Increasing the receive buffer size can increase the performance of network I/O for high-volume connection, while decreasing it can help reduce the backlog of incoming data. This value is also used to set the TCP receive window that is advertized to the remote peer. This option corresponds to the SO_RCVBUF. The value should be a positive integer.

socketSendBufferSize.description: Specify the size of the send buffer in bytes used from the socket opened during the transfer. It is used by the platform's networking code as a hint for the size to set the underlying network I/O buffers. This option corresponds to the SO_SNDBUF. The value should be a positive integer.

bufferSize.description: Specify the size of the buffer in bytes used for reading from the local file system when performing the transfer. This setting is used to optimize the writing of files by allowing large chunk of data to be read in one operation from a local file. The value should be a positive integer. This setting should be set to the highest value possible.

blockSize.description: Specify the SFTP block size value used for the transfer. The value should be a positive integer greater or equal to 512. The defaults value is 32768. It is not recommended to increase the value, more than the default one as the remote server may not be able to support higher block sizes.

tcpNoDelay.description: Enable TCP_NODELAY (disable/enable Nagle's algorithm) for the transfer.

pta.OUT.do.as.description: Specify a value to send the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. ${stenv['target']}_${random()}.

pta.on.tempfail.OUT.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the destination file on temporary failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.on.tempfail.OUT.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on temporary failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder.

pta.on.permfail.OUT.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the destination file on failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.on.permfail.OUT.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder.

pta.on.success.OUT.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on success. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder.

pta.on.success.OUT.do.move.overwrite.description: When the "Allow Overwrite Existing File" option is enabled and the rename operation fails because the target file exists, ST will delete the target file and repeat the rename operation.

pta.IN.do.as.description: Specify a value to receive the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. ${stenv['target']}_${random()}.

pta.on.permfail.IN.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the source file on failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.on.permfail.IN.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder.

pta.on.success.IN.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the source file on success after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.on.success.IN.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on success. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder.

pta.on.success.IN.do.move.overwrite.description: When the "Allow Overwrite Existing File" option is enabled and the rename operation fails because the target file exists, ST will delete the target file and repeat the rename operation.

sender_as2_id.description: Specify the server site AS2 name. Each AS2 transfer site for a user must have a unique Server AS2 Name(sender_as2_id) or Remote Site AS2 Name (receiver_as2_id).

receiver_as2_id.description: Specify the remote site AS2 name. Each AS2 transfer site for a user must have a unique Server AS2 Name(sender_as2_id) or Remote Site AS2 Name (receiver_as2_id).

dmz.description: Specify the remote site network zone. It can be 'any', 'none', 'Default' or custom network zone.

fipsMode.description: Specify if the FIPS transfer mode is enabled. It can be '0' or '1'.

pta.OUT.do.as.description: Specify a value to send the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. '${stenv['target']}_${random()}'.

transfertimeout.description: Specify the transfer timeout in seconds.

encrypt.description: Specify encryption. It can be '3des', 'rc2' (RC2/40), 'rc2/64', 'rc2/128'. NOTE: RC2/40, RC2/64 and RC2/128 are not FIPS compilant.

compress.description: Specify if the transfer should be compressed. It can be '0' or '1'.

enablechunked.description: Specify if file chunking is enabled (large files are sent in multiple parts). It can be '0' or '1'.

as2_mdn_options.description: Specify mdn options e.g 'signed-receipt-protocol=optional, pkcs7-signature; signed-receipt-micalg=optional, sha1'.

as2_mdn_url.description: Specify if site should request receipt for all transfers. It can be '0' or '1'.

as2_mdn_return_url.description: Specify if the receipt request should be asynchronous or synchronous. If this property is specified, than the requests are asynchronous, otherwise synchronous. It can be 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS'.

pta.IN.do.as.description: Specify a value to receive the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. '${stenv['target']}_${random()}'.

require_ssl.description: Specify if SSL Connection is required. It can be '0' or '1'.

require_encrypt.description: Specify if Encryption is required. It can be '0' or '1'.

require_sign.description: Specify if Signature is required. It can be '0' or '1'.

deliveryMethod.description: This property defines the delivery method. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Disabled' then Adhoc is disabled and enrollmentType/implicitEnrollmentType can not be set. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Default' then it is only available on BU and Account (setting the BU to use the value and account to use the BU value). When deliveryMethod is set to 'Anonymous' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous' and "" (Select by sender) are enabled. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Account Without Enrollment' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous', ""  (Select by sender) and 'Existing Account' are enabled. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Account With Enrollment' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous', "" (Select by sender), 'Enroll unlicensed', 'Enroll licensed' are enabled

encryptKeyOwnerExpression.description: You can specify either an account name or use an EL expression to determine the recipient based on the environment information (such as filename). If an account name is unknown (e.g. expression based) its PGP certificates will be determined on runtime. PGP certificates can be expression based as well. All the encrypt key related properties (expressions, owners, types) should be set if an encrypt key is used. Encrypt or sign key usage is mandatory.

encryptKeyExpression.description: PGP encryption name amongst PGP Public Keys (within the selected above account) or by entering an expression for this. Wild card symbols ( asterisk symbol and ?) can also be used when specifying the PGP key alias. If multiple keys match the pattern the first one will be picked up and used.

signKeyOwnerExpression.description: You can specify either an account name or use an EL expression to determine the recipient based on the environment information (such as filename). If an account name is unknown (e.g. expression based) its PGP certificates will be determined on runtime. PGP certificates can be expression based as well. All the sign key related properties (expressions, owners, types) should be set if a sign key is used.

signKeyExpression.description: PGP encryption name amongst PGP Public Keys (within the selected above account) or by entering an expression for this. Wild card symbols ( asterisk symbol and ?) can also be used when specifying the PGP key alias. If multiple keys match the pattern the first one will be picked up and used.

name.description: The name of the login restriction rule. The name can not contain characters "/", ";" and "'"

enabled.description: Define whether the rule should be enabled (true)or disabled (false). Each rule may be temporarily disabled and in that case it will not be used until it is enabled again

type.description: The type of the login restriction rule. The type could be either `ALLOW` and defines a condition (IP and/or expression) to allow login or could be `DENY` and defines a condition (IP and/or expression) to deny login. The rules of the same type are always evaluated as one set of rules - the order is not significant. But the order of evaluation 'AllOW' and 'DENY' sets, depend on the type of the policy they belong to

clientAddress.description:
The client address for the login restriction rule. When the current rule is evaluated it is compared with this client address. If there is no match then the rule is assumed to not match. If the current client address matches to the one defined in the rule and any additional conditions defined in the rule(for example expressions) also match (all of them) then the rule is assumed to match to the current user connection and is applied. 

The value of the client address could be one of:
  - Specific IPv4 address
  - Specific IPv6 address
  - Specific IPv4 address combined with a network mask. Example: 172.23.34.0/24
  - Specific IPv6 address combined with a network mask. Example: FC00:1234:56::/120
  - Specific fully qualified host name. Example: host.domain.com
  - Specific fully qualified host name, which is allowed to contain the * wildcard character. Example: *.domain.com

expression.description: The expression that should be evaluated to true in order for the rule to apply. This expression should be in the form of the SecureTransport expression language. It may include any environment variables, session attributes or other elements which are available at login time. For example it may include expression which evaluates the user class of the current user and compares it with some value. This expression may be not set - empty string or null value, in which case it would not be taken into account (cosider it true)

description.description: The description of a login restriction rule.

duration.description: Defines the time when transfer is finished

operationIndex.description: The operation index of the transfer. It could be '(none)' or some ID.

flowAttrsMergeMode.description: Specify the flow merge mode. Three options are possible: 'preserve', 'overwrite', 'append'.

pta.on.tempfail.IN.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the file on failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.on.tempfail.IN.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on temporary failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder.

pta.on.permfail.IN.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the file on failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.on.permfail.IN.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder.

triggerOnConditionEnabled.description: If checked, processing of files in the subscription folder will be triggered upon a specific condition. It could be 'true' or 'false'.

triggerOnConditionExpression.description: Specify the condition on which to trigger file processing. An expression language can be used.

submitFilterType.description:
Specify the submit filter type. It could be 'FILENAME_PATTERN' or 'TRIGGER_FILE_CONTENT'.
If 'FILENAME_PATTERN' is selected and 'submitFilenamePatternExpression' is with value '*' all files will be submitted for processing in the subscription folder.

If 'FILENAME_PATTERN' is selected and 'submitFilenamePatternExpression' is with some filename pattern, only files matching specific filename pattern will be submitted for processing.

If 'TRIGGER_FILE_CONTENT' is selected, data file names will be read from trigger file content. Each file name should be on new line. The whitespace characters before and after the file names are discarded. Also lines containing only whitespace characters are not considered as files.Trigger file format:file1.txt, file2.txt, file3.png

submitFilenamePatternExpression.description: Specify the file name pattern. An expression language can be used.

ppa.on.fail.IN.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the file on failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'. This action is applied to files arrived to this folder and processed by a route package.

ppa.on.fail.IN.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. This action is applied to files arrived to this folder and processed by a route package.

ppa.on.success.IN.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the file on success after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'. This action is applied to files arrived to this folder and processed by a route package.

ppa.on.success.IN.do.move.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on success. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. This action is applied to files arrived to this folder and processed by a route package.

postClientDownloadType.description: Specify if Post Client Download Actions will be applied to each file successfully downloaded from the subscription folder. It can be 'DELETE' or no property at all.

AdvancedRoutingSubscription.description: A representation of an Advanced Routing subscription.

id.description: The id of the audit log entity

dateModified.description: The modification date of the audit log entity

configurationId.description: The configuration id of the node

operationType.description: The type of the operation logged with the audit log entity

objectType.description: The type of the object for which audit log entity is added

objectIdentifier.description: The id of the audited object

objectName.description: The name of the audited object

objectString.description: The string representation of the audited object

userName.description: The name of the user who did the operation audited

remoteAddress.description: The IP address of the remote client that sent the request

ServiceAccount.title: ServiceAccount
ServiceAccount.description: A representation of a service account.

startTime.description: The time when the transfer started

receipt.description: Defines whether the data is a receipt or not.

GenericHttpSite.title: GenericHttpSite

ghttpUseUriEnabled.description: Flag indicating if partner host and port or partner URL will be used

ghttpHost.description: The host name or IP address of the remote server to connect to

ghttpPort.description: The port of the remote server to connect to

ghttpAddress.description: A URL that specifies the partner host. It can also include the port and a directory

ghttpNetworkZone.description: The network zone that defines the proxy to use for transfers through the site

ghttpSecureHttpEnabled.description: A flag indicating if the connection should be secured or not

ghttpVerifyCertificateEnabled.description: A flag indicating if there should be verification that the remote system is trusted. This verification will apply only when `ghttpSecureHttpEnabled` is set to true

ghttpFipsModeEnabled.description: A flag indicating if FIPS mode is enabled. If enabled - restrict HTTPS to use only FIPS 140-2 Level 1 certified cryptographic libraries. The FIPS mode enablement will apply only when `ghttpSecureHttpEnabled` is set to true

ghttpListEnabled.description: A flag indicating if the connector will operate in a single file download mode or will list files and then perform the download operation(s). If this property has value `true`, the connector will take as an input the result of the configured request and use it as a source for retrieving a list of files to be downloaded and then will use the first request to download each file from the list

ghttpListUrlPath.description:
The HTTP server relative path that will be used to list files on the remote server:
  - a server absolute path when specify partner using hostname (IP address) and port number - example: ```/list.php```
  - a server relative path when specify partner using URL - example: ```list.php```
  
A limited expression language can be used to specify the URL. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true

ghttpListFileExpression.description: The expression for the file names that will be applied on the response for the list request to extract the files list. A Java regular expression and Secure Transprt expression language can be used to specify a pattern to match files that needs to be downloaded. A limited expression language can be used to specify the expression. This expression will be taken into account only if `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true

ghttpListMethod.description: HTTP method to be used for the listing of files on the remote server. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true

ghttpListHeaders.description:
The HTTP headers that will be added in the HTTP request for listing files on the remote server. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true.

Each header should be formed as key-value pair separated with the equal sign. Example: ```["header=value"]```

ghttpListBody.description:
The body of the request for listing files on the remote server. The body will be taken into account only if `ghttpListMethod` has value 'POST' and `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true. A limited expression language can be used to specify the body

Note: when the body content type is `multipart/form-data` or `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` the body should be formed as key-value pairs on separate lines.

Example:
```
   param1=value1
   param2=value2
```

ghttpListBodyContentType.description: The content type of the ghttpListBody. The body content type will be taken into account only if `ghttpListMethod` has value 'POST' and `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true

ghttpDownloadUrlPath.description:
The HTTP server path used to download file(s):
  - a server absolute path when specify partner using hostname (IP address) and port number - example: ```/download.php```
  - a server relative path when specify partner using URL - example: ```download.php```

If `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true, this URL will be used to download single file(s) extracted from the list operation. A limited expression language can be used to specify the URL

ghttpDownloadMethod.description: HTTP method to be used for the download operation. If `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true, this method will be used when performing all download operations for the files listed on the remote server

ghttpDownloadHeaders.description:
The HTTP headers that will be added in the HTTP download request. If `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true, these headers will be added in the all HTTP download requests for the files listed on the remote server.

Each header should be formed as key-value pair separated with the equal sign. Example: ```["header=value"]```

ghttpDownloadBody.description:
The body of the download request. The body will be taken into account only if `ghttpDownloadMethod` has value 'POST'. If `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true, this body will be used for all download operations for the files listed on the remote server. A limited expression language can be used to specify the body.

Note: when the body content type is `multipart/form-data` or `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` the body should be formed as key-value pairs on separate lines.

Example:
```
   param1=value1
   param2=value2
```

ghttpDownloadBodyContentType.description: The content type of the `ghttpDownloadBody` property. The body content type will be taken into account only if `ghttpDownloadMethod` has value 'POST'. If `ghttpListEnabled` is set to true, this body content type will be used for all download operations for the files listed on the remote server

ghttpReceiveFileAsEnabled.description: A flag indicating if receiving file with different name than the original one is enabled

ghttpReceiveFileAsExpression.description: The value to be used as different name for the received file. A limited expression language can be used to specify the file name. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpReceiveFileAsEnabled` is set to true

ghttpUploadUrlPath.description:
The HTTP server path to be used for uploading files to the remote server:
  - a server absolute path when specify partner using hostname (IP address) and port number - example: ```/upload.php```
  - a server relative path when specify partner using URL - example: ```upload.php```
  
A limited expression language can be used to specify the URL

ghttpUploadMethod.description: The HTTP method to be used when uploading files to a remote server

ghttpUploadHeaders.description:
The HTTP headers that will be added in the HTTP request for upload.

Each header should be formed as key-value pair separated with the equal sign. Example: ```["header=value"]```

ghttpUploadBody.description:
The body of the request for uploading files on the remote server. The body will be taken into account only if `ghttpUploadMethod` has value 'POST'. A limited expression language can be used to specify the body.

Note: the body should be formed as key-value pairs on separate lines.

Example:
```
   param1=value1
   param2=value2
```

ghttpUploadBodyContentType.description: The content type of the `ghttpUploadBody`. The body content type will be taken into account only if `ghttpUploadMethod` has value 'POST'

ghttpSendFileAsEnabled.description: A flag indicating if sending file with different name is enabled

ghttpSendFileAsExpression.description: The new file name to be used when sending the file. A limited expression language can be used to specify the file name. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpSendFileAsEnabled` is set to true

clientLocalCertificate.description: The client certificate ID used for mutual authentication

ghttpUserName.description: The user name used to login to a remote HTTP server

ghttpUsePasswordEnabled.description: A flag defining whether to use specified password for login to a remote HTTP server or not

ghttpPassword.description: The password used to login to a remote HTTP server. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpUsePasswordEnabled` is set to true

ghttpFormAuthenticationEnabled.description: A flag indicating if form authentication will be used

ghttpFormUrlPath.description:
The HTTP server path used for sending the form authentication request:
  - a server absolute path when specify partner using hostname (IP address) and port number - example: ```/form.php```
  - a server relative path when specify partner using URL - example: ```form.php```
  
A limited expression language can be used to specify the URL. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpFormAuthenticationEnabled` is set to true

ghttpFormMethod.description: HTTP method to be used for the form authentication to the remote server. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpFormAuthenticationEnabled` is set to true

ghttpFormHeaders.description:
The HTTP headers that will be added in the HTTP request for form authentication. This property will be taken into account only if `ghttpFormAuthenticationEnabled` is set to true

Each header should be formed as key-value pair separated with the equal sign. Example: ```["header=value"]```

ghttpFormBody.description:
The body of the form authentication request. The body will be taken into account only if `ghttpFormMethod` has value 'POST' and `ghttpFormAuthenticationEnabled` is set to true. A limited expression language can be used to specify the body

Note: when the body content type is `multipart/form-data` or `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` the body should be formed as key-value pairs on separate lines.

Example:
```
   param1=value1
   param2=value2
```

ghttpFormBodyContentType.description: The content type of the `ghttpFormBody`. The body content type will be taken into account only if `ghttpFormMethod` has value 'POST' and `ghttpFormAuthenticationEnabled` is set to true

ghttpFileListResponseSize.description: The maximum size in KB of the file list response to handle. If the response exceeds this value, only the specified number of bytes will be processed. The default value is `"100"` KB

ghttpSslCipherSuites.description:
The cipher suites to be used for SSL connection. The cipher suites must be comma separated. The default value is `["TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384", "TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384",
"TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256", "TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256",
"TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384", "TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384",
"TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256", "TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256",
"TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256", "TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256",
"TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256", "TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256",
"TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256", "TLS_EMPTY_RENEGOTIATION_INFO_SCSV"]`

ghttpSslProtocol.description: The SSL protocol to be used for SSL connection. The default value is `"TLS"`

ghttpSslProtocols.description: The enabled SSL protocols. The protocols must be comma separated. The default value is `["TLSv1.2"]`

ghttpReceiveTimeout.description: The socket timeout in seconds. Any non-zero time out will block the input stream associated with the socket with this amount of time. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout. The default value is `"25"` seconds

ghttpConnectTimeout.description: The connection timeout in seconds. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout. The connection will then block until established or an error occurs. The default value is `"25"` seconds

ghttpMaxRedirects.description: The maximum number of redirects to be followed. The limit on number of redirects is intended to prevent infinite loops. The default value is `"1"` redirect.

GenericHttpSite.description: A representation of an GenericHttp site.

UnlicensedAccountMaintApplication.title: UnlicensedAccountMaintApplication

inactivePeriod.description: Specify how long in days an unlicensed account must be inactive before it is deleted.

UnlicensedAccountMaintApplication.description: A representation of an UnlicensedAccountMaint application.

startTime.description: The time when the transfer started

account.description: The name of the account that performed the transfer

login.description: The user login name used for this transfer

userClass.description: The user class. By default the user class can be `VirtClass` or `RealClass`

size.description: The size of the transferred file

sessionId.description: The session ID of the transfer

archivedAs.description: The name under which the transferred file is archived

subtransmissionStatuses.description: Status of the subtransmission operations (if there are any)

requestEntity.description: Representation of the rest api call that initiated the transfer(if submitted through the ST RESTful API).

additionalInformation.description: The additional information related to this transfer.

BasicApplication.title: BasicApplication
BasicApplication.description: A representation of a Basic application.

tag.description:
The type of the application or subscription. 
For application schedule are valid the following application types: 'HumanSystem', 'StandardRouter', 'SiteMailbox', 'SharedFolde'r, 'TransferLogMaint', 'Basic', 'AdvancedRouting', 'LogEntryMaint', 'ArchiveMaint', 'SentinelLinkDataMaint', 'SynchronyTransfer', 'MBFT', 'PackageRetentionMaint', 'UnlicensedAccountMaint', 'AuditLogMaint'. 
For subscription schedule are valid the following options : 'PARTNER-IN', 'PARTNER-OUT'.

startDate.description: The start date in date-time format

endDate.description: The end date in date-time format

userClass.description: The user class. By default the user class can be 'VirtClass' or 'RealClass'

loggedIn.description: The global logged in field. For example '1 (1/0/0)'

instantaneousFTPBandwidth.description: The instantaneous FTP bandwidth. For example '0 bytes/sec'.

localLoggedIn.description: The local logged in field. For example '1 (1/0/0)'

AmazonS3Site.title: AmazonS3Site

s3Bucket.description: Specify the bucket for Amazon S3 Service. A limited expression language can be used to specify the bucket.

s3AccessKey.description: Access key for Amazon S3 authentication.

s3SecretKey.description: Secret key for Amazon S3 authentication.

s3NetworkZone.description:
Specify the remote site network zone. It can be 'any', 'none', 'Default' or custom network zone. 
Amazon S3 connector only supports HTTP proxy type.If the selected Network Zone does not have an HTTP Proxy configured, it would be ignored.

s3Region.description: Amazon S3 region used for connection configuration.

s3DownloadObjectKey.description:
Specify the target Amazon S3 object(file or folder) for download.
If the specified object ID corresponds to an S3 folder, the contents of that folder will be downloaded recursively.
If the field is left empty, no objects will be downloaded. 
A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3PatternType.description:
Specify the download pattern type. Pattern matching expression supports 'glob' and 'regex' syntaxes. 
When the pattern type is "File Globbing" then the String representation of the filename is matched using 
a limited pattern language that resembles regular expressions but with a simpler syntax.

s3DownloadPattern.description: Specify the download pattern. A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3ReceiveFileAsEnabled.description: Flag defining if receiving file with different name is enabled.

s3ReceiveFileAsExpr.description: The expression for the name of the recived file. A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3ReceivePtaFailure.description: The action on the failure download to be executed.

s3ReceivePtaFailureMoveRenameFileExpr.description:
The filename expression for move/rename the file on download failure. 
This property can be set if receivePtaFailure has value moveRenameFile. 
A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3ReceivePtaSuccess.description: The action on the success download to be executed.

s3ReceivePtaSuccessMoveRenameFileExpr.description:
The filename expression for move/rename the file on download success. 
This property can be set if receivePtaSuccess has value moveRenameFile. 
A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3SendFileAsEnabled.description: Flag defining if uploading file with different name is enabled.

s3SendFileAsExpr.description:
The expression for the name of the uploaded file. 
Note: Do not use Amazon S3 folder (forward slash) symbol "/".
A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3UploadDestination.description:
Specifies upload destination Amazon S3 folder. 
"Upload destination" should represents S3 folder, consider that forward slash "/", 
which is the Amazon S3 object folder identification symbol, is automatically appended from the bucket. 
Path should look like this: "folder1/folder2/.../folderN/".
If "Upload destination" is not specified, the file will be uploaded to bucket main "folder". 
A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3SystemMetadata.description:
Specify system defined metadata paramaters as key-value pairs for upload requests. 
For Example:
Setting server side encryption: x-amz-server-side-encryption=AES256
Setting Content Type: Content-Type=text/html; charset=utf-8
A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3UserMetadata.description:
Specify user defined metadata paramaters as key-value pairs for upload requests. 
For example: key=value
A limited expression language can be used for this property.

s3AutoCreateBucketCheck.description: Autocreate the specified bucket if it does not exists on the server side.

AmazonS3Site.description: A representation of an Amazon S3 site.

message.description: A message that gives detailed information about status.

status.description: The overall status of the transfer.

name.description: The name of the configuration option entity.

description.description: The description of the configuration option entity

node.description: The identifier of the cluster node (machine)

encrypted.description: Define if the configuration option value is encrypted

readOnly.description: Define if the configuration option value can be modified

composite.description: Define if the configuration option is composite

specified.description: Define if the configuration option value is specified

disabled.description: Define if the configuration option is disabled

RouteStepRename.title: RouteStepRename

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails

outputFileName.description: Output file name or expression. Example: ${basename(currentfulltarget)}.transformed

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property

actionOnStepFailure.description: Action on step failure. If set to PROCEED, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails

RouteStepRename.description: A representation of a route step of type Rename

HTTPSite.title: HTTPSite

host.description: Specify the remote site server host.

port.description: Specify the remote site server port.

useUri.description: Specify whether to define partner URL or not. If it's 'false', 'host' and 'port' should be specified. Otherwise 'url' should be specified.

dmz.description: Specify the remote site network zone. It can be 'any', 'none', 'Default' or custom network zone.

download.folder.advanced.expression.enab.description: When it is 'true' the download folder is evaluated using expression language.

download.pattern.advanced.expression.ena.description: When it is 'true' the download pattern is evaluated using expression language.

upload.folder.overridable.description: Defines if the upload folder can be modified by the Send To Partner routing step. It can be '0' or '1'.

transfer.mode.description: Specify the transfer mode. It can be A (Ascii), I (Binary). When it is not define the transfer mode is Auto detected.

issecure.description: Specify if FTPS is used or not. It can be '0' or '1'.

verifyCert.description: Verify certificate for this site. This property can be set if FTPS (issecure) is used. It can be '0' or '1'.

fipsMode.description: Specify if the FIPS Transfer Mode is enabled or disabled. This property can be set if FTPS (issecure) is used. It can be '0' or '1'.

usePassword.description: Specify if the login password should be set. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

usePasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have password expressions or not. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

password.description: Specify the site login password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'usePassword' is 'true'.

pta.OUT.do.as.description: Specify a value to send the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. ${stenv['target']}_${random()}.

pta.on.tempfail.OUT.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the destination file on temporary failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.on.permfail.OUT.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the destination file on failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.IN.do.as.description: Specify a value to receive the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. ${stenv['target']}_${random()}.

pta.on.permfail.IN.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the source file on failure after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

pta.on.success.IN.do.delete.description: Defines whether to delete the source file on success after the transmission. It can be 'true' or 'false'.

HTTPSite.description: A representation of an HTTP(S) site.

SharePointSite.title: SharePointSite

sharepoint_useUri.description: Flag indicating id host and port or URL will be specified

sharepoint_downloadFolderAdvancedExpress.description: Flag to define whether to set the download folder as advanced expression or with regular folder name

sharepoint_downloadFolder.description: The folder name of the SharePoint repository to download files from. This property is expression language enabled if sharepoint_downloadFolderAdvancedExpressionEnabled is set to true

sharepoint_downloadPatternAdvancedExpres.description:
Flag to define whether to set download pattern as advanced expression or with regex/glob.
When is set to true, the sharepoint_advanced_download_start_date and sharepoint_advanced_download_end_date can be set with an expressin.

sharepoint_downloadPattern.description: The download pattern. This property is expression language enabled if sharepoint_downloadPatternAdvancedExpressionEnabled is set to true

sharepoint_useAdvancedDownloadOptions.description: Flag to define whether to enable advanced download options

sharepoint_download_files_count.description: SharePoint download file(s) count or specific file version label (if download file version is 'specific')

sharepoint_advanced_download_start_date.description: The start date for downloading. This property can be set only if advancedDownloadOption is set to 'downloadVersionByDate'. The sharepoint_advanced_download_end_date must be set, too. All files on the SharePoint repository that are created after the specified start date and before specified end date will be downloaded. This property is expression language enabled

sharepoint_advanced_download_end_date.description: The end date for downloading. This property can be set only if advancedDownloadOption is set to 'downloadVersionByDate'. The sharepoint_advanced_download_startd_date must be set, too. All files on the SharePoint repository that are created after the specified start date and before specified end date will be downloaded. This property is expression language enabled

sharepoint_receiveFileAsEnabled.description: Flag defining if receiving file with different name is enabled

sharepoint_receiveFileAsExpr.description: The expression for the name of the file

sharepoint_receivePtaFailure.description: The action on the failure download to be executed

sharepoint_receivePtaFailure_moveRenameF.description: The filename expression for move/rename the file on download failure. This property can be set if receivePtaFailure has value moveRenameFile

sharepoint_receivePtaSuccess.description: The action on the success download to be executed.

sharepoint_receivePtaSuccess_moveRenameF.description: The filename expression for move/rename the file on download success. This property can be set if receivePtaSuccess has value moveRenameFile

sharepoint_uploadFolderAdvancedExpressio.description: Flag to define whether to set the upload folder as advanced expression or with regular folder name

sharepoint_uploadFolder.description: The name of the upload folder

sharepoint_sendFileAsEnabled.description: Flag defining if sending file with different name is enabled

sharepoint_sendFileAsExpr.description: The expression for the name of the file to send

sharepoint_sendPtaSuccess.description: The action on the success upload to be executed.

sharepoint_sendPtaSuccessExpr_publish.description: The check-in comment for the publish file action. This property can be set if sendPtaSuccess has value publish

sharepoint_username.description: The user name to log in the SharePoint repository

sharepoint_usePassword_Control.description: Flag to define whether to use specified password for logging in the SharePoint repository

sharepoint_secureHTTP.description: flag to define whether to enable secure HTTP connection

sharepoint_verifyCert.description: Flag to define whether to verify certificate.

SharePointSite.description: A representation of an SharePoint site.
